Moe Howard.Action: Confirms the location confidently: 'This is the place all right.'
Does not reprimand Curly immediately for damaging property, though Larry does.
Rushes to Curly's aid and helps free him from the paint cans and bucket.
Expresses sympathy and interest when Curly reveals Gertie is about to have a baby.
Calls Curly 'puddin'-head' in a mild teasing way while trying to understand his behavior.
Approaches Mr. Rumsford confidently, performs a mock medical exam using a shoe horn as a tongue depressor, directs others and attempts to take charge of the situation.
Misidentifies the patient (thinks Mr. Rumsford is the patient instead of Mrs. Rumsford).
Accidentally causes a minor mishap by plowing into Williams, creating a mess but does not react negatively or harshly.
Responds casually to Rumsford's concern about Sherry by declining to discuss her and instead requesting Scotch.
Moe signals Larry and Curly with his eyes and head to something offstage, showing his awareness and ability to guide others to a better option.
Moe takes the initiative to smell the Scotch, assessing its quality before deciding it will be better, demonstrating good judgment and decisiveness.
Pours Worcestershire sauce into the punch bowl as an unconventional experiment, shows a casual confidence in trying something new.
Gets champagne cork wedged in his eye due to Curly’s reckless popping, demonstrates a momentary lack of caution.
Confronts Curly about mishandling the champagne bottle and demands control to prevent further mishaps, showing some leadership and attempt at control.
Bops Curly’s head multiple times to discipline him after receiving a champagne spray, indicating frustration but also trying to maintain order.
Tries to penetrate the tamale with a spoon and then manhandles it to open it but fails to figure out the simple way to unwrap it first.
Attempts several methods (finger-poking, squeezing, slamming) to open the tamale but only creates a mess and gets sauce on his face.
Tries to wipe sauce off, making it worse and calls the tamale ‘a bomb’ and ‘an infernal machine,’ showing frustration.
Eventually follows Curly’s lead to unwrap and eat the tamale, showing some adaptability but only after repeated failed attempts.
Identifies the correct location confidently and carries a toolbox indicating preparedness.
Allows Curly to accidentally smash the glass door and water cooler without intervening to prevent damage.
Pokes Curly in the eye after Curly accidentally hits him with a ladder, then hits him over the head with a pencil and pulls his hair.
Shows annoyance and impatience by grabbing pencils away from Curly repeatedly and threatening him.
Immediately shifts to a professional and serious tone when the secretary arrives, addressing the problem sincerely.
Plows into Williams, upsetting a tray and causing a minor accident.
Responds to Rumsford's dilemma with a confident and casual remark, showing social ease and control of the situation.
Moe directs Larry and Curly discreetly with eye and head motions to avoid Rumsford and approach the drinks table.
Moe opens a bottle of Scotch and suggests it will help improve the weak punch.
Jokes by pouring Worcestershire sauce into punch bowl, showing playful camaraderie.
Scolds Curly for handling champagne cork dangerously but insists on getting the bottle, showing concern and authority mixed with care.
Bops Curly's head several times after being sprayed with champagne foam, demonstrating a roughly affectionate reprimand rather than hostile intent.
Responds politely to Rumsford's request to examine his wife, says 'A pleasure.'
Stands nearby watching Curly interact with Sherry and the Countess, does not intervene when Curly offends the Countess.
Calls the test of Sherry's reflex an orderly procedure by stating 'Now, uh, we shall test your reflex first.'
Fails to control or correct Curly's inappropriate and unprofessional behavior during the medical examination.
Follows Rumsford promptly to attend to the task at hand after being asked to look over Rumsford's wife.
Does not intervene or effectively manage the chaotic or disruptive situation caused by Curly's antics.
Kneels beside Curly to teach him how to tap below the knee, trying patiently despite failure.
Upsetly tells Curly 'Trouble is, you've got no life.'
Kettle drums Curly in the stomach after unsuccessful tapping attempts.
Participates enthusiastically in playful antics with Larry and Curly, jumping over the sofa and joining piggy-back rides.
Grabs Larry violently by the hair when Larry tries to flirt with the lady next to him at the dinner table.
Moe straightens up and turns to Larry, commands 'Eats!,' then jumps over the sofa confidently.
Grabs Larry violently by the hair to stop him from flirting during dinner.
Grabs Larry violently by the hair to stop him from flirting inappropriately.
Lightly teases Larry with a reference to etiquette, encouraging polite behavior in a friendly manner.
Takes a biscuit politely alongside Larry without causing disruption or offense.
Grimly ironic comment about Curly's antics, shows dry humor rather than overt friendliness.
Peers suspiciously and cautiously at tamales, taps them lightly before pounding them to test.
Makes a grimly ironic remark about Curly's powder puff incident, showing awareness of the situation.
Tucks napkin into his collar and aggressively manhandles the tamale, tries to squeeze the life out of it.
Slammed the tamale down causing sauce to squirt and blacken his face, reacts humorously by calling it 'a bomb, an infernal machine!'
Claps hands satisfied after eating tamale husk like a sandwich despite initial displeasure.
Smacks Larry on the forehead after pulling him off his lap.
Prepares to throw a cream puff at Curly and actually throws it at the Countess, hitting her on the forehead.
Grabs Larry by the hair to remove him from his lap and smacks him on the forehead to assert control.
Picks up a cream puff to throw at Curly in retaliation during a chaotic food fight.
Blames Curly playfully during the cream puff fight, engages actively in the fun food fight
Hits the Countess with cream puffs despite her defiant reaction
Takes the entire wad of money from Rumsford without protest.
Takes the entire wad of cash without hesitation when offered by Rumsford.
